Description: Fragmentary painted pottery Fikellura neck-amphora. Neck, meander and square. Shoulder, tongues: A, ?, goat, lion or dog (an ear, which is the only relic of the animal on the left, seems like a dog's ear, pricked forward). Belly, chevrons: lotus flowers and buds, unjoined : crescents, crescents: blobs. On the inside of the belly there are plummy red smears; the red substance, according to the Museum laboratory, is a ferruginous earth (cf. GR 1888.6-1.5616, Pl. GB 578.1-2).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 27
Curator's comments: Findspot number '27' scratched on the item.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 580, 1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 195)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.209)
Condition: Half the body missing; repaired from fragments
